description: Lenart Kova, frustrated by failures of the Council-approved patch, decides to secretly activate Halden’s old adaptive algorithms to restore BCI function, gambling on system stability.
Reactivated legacy code begins overriding Council patches, subtly shifting how BCI scores respond to behavior. Lenart monitors changes, unsure of the new system’s direction.

Residents across Stenograd notice strange reversals in BCI-based privileges: citizens with spotless records are inexplicably restricted, while formerly flagged individuals receive unexpected benefits.
Confused by inconsistent BCI outcomes, residents turn to informal networks to buy 'score skins'—forged behavioral profiles used to manipulate system responses and regain lost access.
Council investigators trace the erratic BCI behavior to reactivated adaptive code from Halden’s era. Council factions clash over how to regain control as trust in the official system erodes.
